summary.snippet: "I never expected such a small restaurant would serve such wonderful food."
"Pork buns dry and weird peanut topping."
"The broth was flavorful, and the noodles were cooked to perfection."

most_relevant.description: This Asian food court was a delightful surprise! The BYOB (Bring Your Own Beverage purchased in the next Asian supermarket) policy was a great touch, allowing us to pair our meals with our favorite drinks. The menu offered a fantastic variety of Asian cuisines, and everything we tried was incredibly authentic. We're already looking forward to exploring more options on our next visit.

This place is amazing!!! Attached to the lovely Galleria store. We had the pork belly buns, they are large and delicious, would probably get them without peanuts next time though. the tofu stew is INCREDIBLE! also got the tuna rice sandwich, it's spicy but absolutely delicious. also go the Lobster Roll that was on special, it was perfect!! everything was awesome and so well priced. the lady working the counter was so sweet and kind. go here now!

Love this place! ‚ù§Ô∏èü•∞ Newly Sushi place and quick meals.

They are in the same building with Galleria Market so, that is a plus to go for food and shopping. So many menu to try. They place is really nice and clean.
Food was really good and in a very reasonable price.
I order 3 of different kind of üçôOnigiri,
üçúDan Dan men(Noodle),
üçóKorean Chicken wings,
üåØShrimp, chicken spring roll.

I really recommend for you to try! üëçüèª

Ok, so I know my photo is of an empty bowl but I can't properly convey how beautiful and delicious that veg Bibimbap looked with the perfect egg on top perfectly drizzled in chili AND the miso soup!!!!

This food was scrumdidillyumptious. I didn't know this spot was here, but the people were nice. The art was super cool. Oh, I do have some pictures of the art ,ignore my forehead.

Anyway, if you are in the area and want some good food from nice people, do it. I'm probably going to try the Yakisoba next and grab some of their Onigiri to try as well....or I might just get the Bibimbap AGAIN and try something else another time lol. We'll see, either way a photo of the food before I devour my carryout is in order. Thank you Korner Kitchen

Came here on a whim for a quick lunch to try something different. I got the Gimbop Tempura Roll and a miso soup. Never had this roll before and it‚Äôs literally the best thing I‚Äôve eaten all month. I ate in the car bc I was gross from yard work and almost walked back in and bought another one. Miso was delicious as well, I‚Äôve already texted two ppl about this place. I‚Äôll be back for sure!‚úåüèæ

We love the food here! The sushi is so fresh and the ramen is excellent. We are obsessed with the crab rangoons, too. We are slowly making our way through the menu and I feel obligated to tell everyone that it‚Äôs our new favorite place (enthusiastically!!). Use the QR code on their printed menu to order ahead, I usually just call.

I want this restaurant to thrive but in all honesty I have to share my recent negative experience.   I ordered the sweet potato tempura sushi roll.   Unfortunately the sweet potato breading was rubbery and cold and it didn‚Äôt seem very fresh.   It‚Äôs a little thing but I asked for a side of eel sauce and it wasn‚Äôt included.
I also ordered the Bi Bim Bop, my favorite Korean dish.   The meat and rice were tasty and perfectly done.    The veggies were fresh but bland.  The egg was way over cooked being so crunchy on the bottom you had to cut it with a sharp knife  and the yolk was hard not soft.   It was a huge disappointment.   Lastly I didn‚Äôt expect the whole thing to be drenched in hot sauce.   I expect the Kim-chi to be spicy but have never had this dish soaked in hot sauce.   Unfortunately I couldn‚Äôt eat it because to me it was painfully spicy.    I asked for this over the phone so maybe it‚Äôs a misunderstanding and I now know to ask for zero hot sauce.

The red bean ice cream was generous and delicious.  I will be back for that.

I hope this nice little restaurant can work out these bugs in good preparation.   I will try them again but go in and order personally to see if that helps.
Amazing gyoza, sweet potato tempura,  and fried rice. Also picked up some sweets from the store while waiting for my to-go order.
